purpose.summary: This copybook defines the data structures COPAU1AI and COPAU1AO, which are used for screen input and output related to authorization processing. It includes fields for transaction name, titles, date, time, card number, authorization details, merchant information, and error messages.
purpose.business_context: This copybook is used in online CICS applications to define the data structures for screen displays and data transfer related to authorization processes.

paragraphs.purpose: This data structure defines the input fields for the COPAU01 screen. It contains various fields related to transaction details, card information, authorization details, and merchant information. Each field is defined with its length, format, and a corresponding indicator. The structure includes fields for transaction name (TRNNAMEL, TRNNAMEF, TRNNAMEI), titles (TITLE01L, TITLE01F, TITLE01I, TITLE02L, TITLE02F, TITLE02I), current date and time (CURDATEL, CURDATEF, CURDATEI, CURTIMEL, CURTIMEF, CURTIMEI), card number (CARDNUML, CARDNUMF, CARDNUMI), authorization details (AUTHDTL, AUTHDTF, AUTHDTI, AUTHTML, AUTHTMF, AUTHTMI, AUTHRSPL, AUTHRSPF, AUTHRSPI, AUTHRSNL, AUTHRSNF, AUTHRSNI, AUTHCDL, AUTHCDF, AUTHCDI, AUTHAMTL, AUTHAMTF, AUTHAMTI), POS entry mode (POSEMDL, POSEMDF, POSEMDI), authorization source (AUTHSRCL, AUTHSRCF, AUTHSRCI), MCC code (MCCCDL, MCCCDF, MCCCDI), card expiry (CRDEXPL, CRDEXPF, CRDEXPI), authorization type (AUTHTYPL, AUTHTYPF, AUTHTYPI), transaction ID (TRNIDL, TRNIDF, TRNIDI), authorization match (AUTHMTCL, AUTHMTCF, AUTHMTCI), authorization fraud (AUTHFRDL, AUTHFRDF, AUTHFRDI), merchant details (MERNAMEL, MERNAMEF, MERNAMEI, MERIDL, MERIDF, MERIDI, MERCITYL, MERCITYF, MERCITYI, MERSTL, MERSTF, MERSTI, MERZIPL, MERZIPF, MERZIPI), and error message (ERRMSGL, ERRMSGF, ERRMSGI). These fields are used to receive data from the screen and pass it to the application logic for processing.
paragraphs.dead_code_reason: Record layout 'COPAU1AI' is never used by any program

paragraphs.purpose: This data structure redefines the COPAU1AI structure (line 181) and is used for output to the screen. It provides a different view of the same data, allowing the program to format and display the information on the screen. The structure includes fields corresponding to the input fields in COPAU1AI, but with different PICTURE clauses, primarily using 'X' to represent alphanumeric characters. These fields are named with suffixes 'C', 'P', 'H', 'V', and 'O' (e.g., TRNNAMEC, TRNNAMEP, TRNNAMEH, TRNNAMEV, TRNNAMEO) to represent control characters, presentation attributes, highlighting, validation, and output values, respectively. The structure includes redefinitions for transaction name, titles, current date and time, card number, authorization details, POS entry mode, authorization source, MCC code, card expiry, authorization type, transaction ID, authorization match, authorization fraud, merchant details, and error message. This structure is used to format the data for display on the screen, setting attributes such as color, highlighting, and validation rules.

open_questions.context: The copybook defines screen fields, but the specific CICS commands that utilize it are not evident from the copybook itself.
open_questions.suggestion: Review the BMS map definitions and CICS programs that use this map to identify the specific CICS commands (e.g., SEND MAP, RECEIVE MAP) that interact with this copybook.

dead_code.reason: Record layout 'COPAU1AI' is never used by any program
